refsect2.title: GSF_ERROR
refsect2.para: This convenience macro simply calls gsf_error_quark(). You can use it in calls to g_error_matches(), for example. The macro returns the GQuark that is used to identify errors from libgsf functions. Specific error codes come from the GsfError enumeration.

refsect2.title: enum GsfError
refsect2.para: Error codes that can be returned from libgsf functions in GError structures.

listitem.simpara: Not enough memory could be allocated to hold a structure or object.
A file being read contained invalid or inconsistent data.

refsect2.title: gsf_error_quark ()
refsect2.para: Returns the GQuark used to identify libgsf errors in GError structures. Specific error codes come from the GsfError enumeration.

listitem.simpara: A GQuark.

refsect2.title: gsf_mem_dump ()
refsect2.para: Dump len bytes from the memory location given by ptr.

listitem.simpara: memory area to be dumped.
how many bytes will be dumped.

refsect2.title: gsf_input_dump ()
refsect2.para: Dumps input's contents to STDOUT, optionally in hex format.

listitem.simpara: a GsfInput
If TRUE, dump in hexidecmal format

refsect2.title: gsf_filename_to_utf8 ()
refsect2.para: A utility wrapper to make sure filenames are valid utf8. Caller must g_free the result.

listitem.simpara: file name suitable for open(2).
if TRUE, the resulting utf8 file name will be quoted (unless it is invalid).
filename using utf-8 encoding for display

refsect2.title: gsf_extension_pointer ()
refsect2.para: Extracts the extension from the end of a filename (the part after the final '.' in the filename).

listitem.simpara: A filename or file path.
A pointer to the extension part of the filename, or a pointer to the end of the string if the filename does not have an extension.

refsect2.title: gsf_base64_encode_close ()
refsect2.programlisting: size_t gsf_base64_encode_close (guint8 const *in, size_t inlen, gboolean break_lines, guint8 *out, int *state, guint *save);

refsect2.title: gsf_base64_encode_step ()
refsect2.programlisting: size_t gsf_base64_encode_step (guint8 const *in, size_t len, gboolean break_lines, guint8 *out, int *state, guint *save);

refsect2.title: gsf_base64_decode_step ()
refsect2.programlisting: size_t gsf_base64_decode_step (guint8 const *in, size_t len, guint8 *out, int *state, guint *save);
refsect2.para: Decodes a chunk of base64 encoded data

listitem.simpara: input stream
max length of data to decode
output stream
holds the number of bits that are stored in save
leftover bits that have not yet been decoded
the number of bytes converted

refsect2.title: GsfTimestamp
gsf_timestamp_new ()

listitem.simpara: the current value of prop, and replaces it with val Caller is responsible for unsetting and freeing the result.

refsect2.title: gsf_property_settings_collect ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gsf_property_settings_collect (GType object_type, GParameter **p_params, size_t *p_n_params, const gchar *first_property_name, ...);

refsect2.title: gsf_property_settings_collect_valist ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gsf_property_settings_collect_valist (GType object_type, GParameter **p_params, size_t *p_n_params, const gchar *first_property_name, va_list var_args);
refsect2.para: This function builds a GParameter array suitable for g_object_newv.

listitem.simpara: the GType for which the properties are being set.
a pointer to the GParameter array that holds the properties. (Used for both input and output. This may point to a NULL pointer if there are no properties collected yet.)
a pointer to the number of properties collected. (Used for both input and output.)
the name of the first property being set, or NULL.
a va_list holding the remainder of the property names and values, terminated by a NULL.
